name: Bourbon BBQ Pork Sandwich
headline: Bourbon BBQ Pork Sandwich
recipeIngredient: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
3 scallions, white and green parts, chopped
2 cups pulled Simple Roasted Pork Shoulder, recipe follows
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: For the cole slaw: In a medium bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar and hot sauce. Season with salt and pepper and add the cabbages and scallions. Toss well to distribute the mayonnaise thoroughly.

For the pork: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, add the olive oil and garlic. When the garlic becomes fragrant, add the barbecue sauce and bourbon. Add the pork to the barbecue sauce and stir well to combine. Simmer about 10 minutes.
To serve: Place the pork on the bread and top with the coleslaw. Drizzle with some extra sauce and serve immediately.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
In a small bowl, mix the olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Using a pastry brush, spread the mixture all over the pork shoulder.

Set the meat on a rack set into a roasting pan. Roast for 20 minutes, and then reduce the heat to 325 degrees F. Continue to cook until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the shoulder reads 185 degrees F, about 4 hours. Remove the pork from the oven and let stand until cool enough to handle, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: OMG! I followed the recipe to the T and the best pork and sauce I have ever made. After the meat was done I put the fat back in and OMG! A KEEPER
I love this guy! I just found his shows and I'm already looking up his recipes. Definitely my new favorite chef.

This recipe was so simple but was the best tasting pork type roast I've ever made.  I continue to look for recipes from Big Daddy because every one that I have tried comes out great.  His recipes are always quick, easy and delicious.  I've been missing him on FN but is see he's on Friday mornings.  I'll be setting my DVR for him.

This sandwich was delicious!! The pulled pork was easy and so tender and our favorite part was tearing off the crispy parts on the outside. I really like the tangy coleslaw inside the sandwich too... it worked well with the sweetness of the BBQ sauce.

The only change I made is leaving out the Bourbon from the BBQ sauce since we don't care for alcohol.

I made this for a superbowl party and it was a big hit, Thanks Big Daddy!

Pork was delicious, I used Makers Mark bourbon for the sauce and it over powered the BBQ flavor. I would use less bourbon if I tried the sauce recipe again...could have been at risk for a DUI with his one.

This recipe was delicious and so easy. I did not follow the slaw portion of the recipe because I had made my own the day before, but the pork and bbq sauce recipe turned out delicious. My family really enjoyed it and the leftovers are even better!

Oh Big Daddy, I am just not feeling the love.  I made the roast, it was great.  I made the pasta, was not a huge fan.  I made this BBQ recipe and have to admit, I guess I am really not a bourbon fan.  My kids would not eat it.  I felt there was too much sauce for the meat.  The slaw was bland and not that great, so I doctored it up the way we usually have it (we like vinegar and sugar with celery seed.  I have yet to try the Udon Noodle Soup.  Keeping my fingers crossed on that one.
This was very good and very tasty, didn't use the bourbon BBQ sauce, I used the Neely's BBQ sauce and the cole slaw was awesome, I make it all the time!
The best pull pork EVER! You will need a lot of napkins!
Love this recipe!!! Absolutely delicious and very easy to make. Definitely a good way to switch up bbq in the summer and will be a good sandwich for Football Sundays!!!!! WoopWoop!!!!
For a quick and easy recipe, this is really, really good. Once the pork is cooked,  it's a cinch.   My husband loved it!!

All,

That BBQ sandwich was a party in the mouth that would convert a kosher north eastern girl into a Georgia peach in the first bite. I used two BBQ sauces 1\2 Sweet Baby Rays Hickory Brown Sugar the other 1\2 Stubs Honey Pecan. URLS are below. If you Google them they will appear as your first link.

I did it!!!! The coleslaw was great! We don't eat pork, so I broiled some chicken thighs and and pulled the meat off the bone.....wow! My husband went bizerk! The sauce was amazing! Thanks Big Daddy!!!!
I made this recipe and it was delicious and easy!! The slaw was easy and had such a nice blend of flavors, creamy, tangy and then the kick of hot sauce made it perfect!!
